translated: The Chapter on the Conditions🔽The Triad-Couplet-Conditioned Arising Discourse

original: Dhammānulomapaccanīya (3), Tikadukapaṭṭhānapāḷi (4)🔽16.95. Sanidassanattika, Saraṇaduka🔽Anidassanaappaṭighaṁ saraṇaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naanidassanaappaṭigho nasaraṇo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā cha, adhipatiyā cha …pe… avigate cha.🔽Anidassanaappaṭighaṁ araṇaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā nasanidassanasappaṭigho naaraṇo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.🔽(Sahajātavārampi …pe… sampayuttavārampi paṭiccavārasadisaṁ.)
analyzed: dhamma anuloma paccanīya tika duka paṭṭhāna pāḷi  sani dassana ttika sa raṇa duka  anidassana appaṭigham saraṇam dhammam paṭicca na anidassana appaṭighaḥ na saraṇaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā cha adhipatiyā cha pe avigate cha  anidassana appaṭigham araṇam dhammam paccayā na sa nidassana sappaṭighaḥ na araṇaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi  sahajāta vārampi pe sampayutta vārampi paṭicca vāra sadisa

original: Sanidassanasappaṭigho araṇo dhammo nasanidassanasappaṭighassa naaraṇassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: sa nidassana sappaṭighaḥ araṇaḥ dhammaḥ na sa nidassana sappaṭighassa na araṇassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ saṅkhitta
translated: With-object-surface, not-refuge, a condition being a condition by way of object condition … (and so on in detail as in the case of the triad-couplet-conditioned arising discourse with-object-surface, with-obstacle, with-object-surface, not-refuge, a condition being a condition by way of object condition … (and so on in detail as in the case of the triad-couplet-conditioned original: Ārammaṇe adhipatiyā nava, anantare samanantare tīṇi, nissaye tīṇi, upanissaye purejāte nava, vippayutte tīṇi …pe… avigate nava.
analyzed: ārammaṇe adhipatiyā nava anantare samanantare tīṇi nissaye tīṇi upanissaye purejāte nava vippayutte tīṇi pe avigate nava
translated: Nine are by predominance in the object. Three are by proximity and by contiguity. Three are by support. Nine are by prenascence. Three are by dissociation. …

original: (Yathā kusalattike pañhāvārassa anulomampi paccanīyampi anulomapaccanīyampi paccanīyānulomampi gaṇitaṁ, evaṁ gaṇetabbaṁ.)
analyzed: yathā kusala ttike pañhāvārassa anulomam pi paccanīyam pi anuloma paccanīyam pi paccanīya anulomam pi gaṇitaḥ evam gaṇetabba
translated: (The method of exposition should be understood in the way beginning, “As in the case of the questions in the chapter of the Triad of the Wholesome in the Paṭṭhāna, so too should it be treated in the case of the questions in the chapter of the dyads and the chapter of the unwholesome dyads.”)
